name: Automate Everhour Time-off Sync to Google Calendar with All-day Events
description:
## Who’s it for
Teams that track absences in **Everhour** and want a shared **Google Calendar** view for quick planning. Ideal for managers, HR/OPS, and teammates who need instant visibility into approved time off.

## What it does
- Pulls **approved time-off** from Everhour on a schedule  
- Creates/updates **all-day events** per day of absence in Google Calendar  
- Removes **stale events** if a request changes or is canceled  
- Uses a stable external key (`everhour:ASSIGNMENT_ID:YYYY-MM-DD`) to avoid duplicates

## How it works
A **Schedule Trigger** runs periodically → the workflow fetches Everhour assignments, filters **approved** time-off, expands multi-day requests into single-day items, then **searches by external key** to either create or update events. Separate cleanup steps **list** calendar events and **delete** any that are no longer present in Everhour.

## How to set up
1. In n8n, create an **HTTP Header Auth** credential for Everhour with header `X-Api-Key: {YOUR_EVERHOUR_API_KEY}
`.  
2. Add a **Google Calendar OAuth** credential.  
3. Open the **Config** node and set your `calendarId` (e.g., `team@group.calendar.google.com`).  
4. Enable the workflow and choose your schedule.

## Requirements
- Everhour account with API access  
- Google Calendar (workspace or personal)  
- n8n Cloud or self-hosted

## How to customize the workflow
- Adjust the **schedule** (hourly/daily).  
- Filter by **user** or **time-off type**.  
- Tweak the **event title/description** templates.  
- Point to multiple calendars (duplicate the create/update branch per calendar).

parameters.content:
## Everhour time-off sync to Google Calendar

### Who’s it for
Teams using **Everhour** for time tracking and **Google Calendar** for visibility.

### What it does
- Fetches **approved time-off** from Everhour
- Creates/updates **all-day events** per day of absence
- Deletes **stale events** if requests change or are canceled

### How it works
1. **Schedule Trigger** runs on an interval.
2. Fetch Everhour assignments via API (Header Auth — set your Everhour API key in n8n credentials).
3. Filter to **approved** time-off.
4. Create/update events keyed by `everhour:<assignmentId>:<YYYY-MM-DD>`.
5. Remove obsolete calendar events by comparing current keys with what’s on the calendar.

### Setup
- Create Everhour **Header Auth** credential: `X-Api-Key: <YOUR_EVERHOUR_API_KEY>`.
- Add your **Google Calendar** OAuth credential to Calendar nodes.
- In the **Config** node, set `calendarId` (e.g., `team@group.calendar.google.com`).

### Customize
- Change schedule cadence.
- Filter by users/time-off types.
- Adjust event title/description template.

## **Fetch Everhour**

Fetch approved time-off from Everhour using Header Auth (no keys in node).

## **Upsert Events**

Search by key → update if found, otherwise create all-day event.

## **Cleanup**

List events and delete those not present in current keys.

main.node: Find Existing Event by External Key

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
